name: Ext.ux.event.Player
doc:
This class manages the playback of an array of "event descriptors". For details on the contents of an "event descriptor", see Ext.ux.event.Recorder. The events recorded by the Ext.ux.event.Recorder class are designed to serve as input for this class.

The simplest use of this class is to instantiate it with an eventQueue and call start. Like so:

 var player = Ext.create('Ext.ux.event.Player', {
     eventQueue: [ ... ],
     speed: 2,  // play at 2x speed
     listeners: {
         stop: function() {
             player = null; // all done
         }
     }
 });

 player.start();

A more complex use would be to incorporate keyframe generation after playing certain events.

 var player = Ext.create('Ext.ux.event.Player', {
     eventQueue: [ ... ],
     keyFrameEvents: {
         click: true
     },
     listeners: {
         stop: function() {
             // play has completed... probably time for another keyframe...
             player = null;
         },
         keyframe: onKeyFrame
     }
 });

 player.start();

If a keyframe can be handled immediately (synchronously), the listener would be:

 function onKeyFrame () {
     handleKeyFrame();
 }

If the keyframe event is always handled asynchronously, then the event listener is only a bit more:

 function onKeyFrame (p, eventDescriptor) {
     eventDescriptor.defer(); // pause event playback...

     handleKeyFrame(function() {
         eventDescriptor.finish(); // ...resume event playback
     });
 }

Finally, if the keyframe could be either handled synchronously or asynchronously (perhaps differently by browser), a slightly more complex listener is required.

 function onKeyFrame (p, eventDescriptor) {
     var async;

     handleKeyFrame(function() {
         // either this callback is being called immediately by handleKeyFrame (in
         // which case async is undefined) or it is being called later (in which case
         // async will be true).

         if (async) {
             eventDescriptor.finish();
         }
         else {
             async = false;
         }
     });

     // either the callback was called (and async is now false) or it was not
     // called (and async remains undefined).

     if (async !== false) {
         eventDescriptor.defer();
         async = true; // let the callback know that we have gone async
     }
 }

members.name: eventQueue
members.doc: The event queue to playback. This must be provided before the start method is called.
members.short_doc: The event queue to playback. ...

members.name: keyFrameEvents
members.doc: An object that describes the events that should generate keyframe events. For example, { click: true } would generate keyframe events after each click event.
members.short_doc:
An object that describes the events that should generate
keyframe events. ...

members.name: pauseForAnimations
members.doc: True to pause event playback during animations, false to ignore animations. Default is true.
members.short_doc:
True to pause event playback during animations, false
to ignore animations. ...

members.name: speed
members.doc: The playback speed multiplier. Default is 1.0 (to playback at the recorded speed). A value of 2 would playback at 2x speed.
members.short_doc: The playback speed multiplier. ...

members.name: active
specialKeysByCode
specialKeysByName
members.default: {PGUP: 33, PGDN: 34, END: 35, HOME: 36, LEFT: 37, UP: 38, RIGHT: 39, DOWN: 40}

members.name: getElementFromXPath
members.doc: Returns the element given is XPath-like description.
members.short_doc: Returns the element given is XPath-like description. ...

members.name: getTime
getTimestamp
members.doc: Returns the number of milliseconds since start was called.
members.short_doc: Returns the number of milliseconds since start was called. ...

members.name: injectEvent
members.doc: Called to inject the given event on the specified target.

params.name: event
params.doc: The event to inject. The properties of this object should be those of standard DOM events but vary based on the type property. For details on event types and their properties, see the class documentation.

members.short_doc: Called to inject the given event on the specified target. ...

members.name: injectKeyEvent
members.doc:
Injects a key event using the given event information to populate the event object.

Note: keydown causes Safari 2.x to crash.

params.name: options
params.doc: Object object containing all of the event injection options.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: The type of event to fire. This can be any one of the following: keyup, keydown and keypress.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.doc: tru if the event can be bubbled up. DOM Level 3 specifies that all key events bubble by default.

properties.name: cancelable
properties.doc: true if the event can be canceled using preventDefault. DOM Level 3 specifies that all key events can be cancelled.

properties.name: ctrlKey
properties.doc: true if one of the CTRL keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: altKey
properties.doc: true if one of the ALT keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: shiftKey
properties.doc: true if one of the SHIFT keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: metaKey
properties.doc: true if one of the META keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: keyCode
properties.doc: The code for the key that is in use.

properties.name: charCode
properties.doc: The Unicode code for the character associated with the key being used.

params.name: view
params.doc: The view containing the target. This is typically the window object.

members.short_doc:
Injects a key event using the given event information to populate the event
object. ...

members.name: injectMouseEvent
members.doc: Injects a mouse event using the given event information to populate the event object.

params.name: options
params.doc: Object object containing all of the event injection options.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: The type of event to fire. This can be any one of the following: click, dblclick, mousedown, mouseup, mouseout, mouseover and mousemove.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.doc: tru if the event can be bubbled up. DOM Level 2 specifies that all mouse events bubble by default.

properties.name: cancelable
properties.doc: true if the event can be canceled using preventDefault. DOM Level 2 specifies that all mouse events except mousemove can be cancelled. This defaults to false for mousemove.

properties.name: ctrlKey
properties.doc: true if one of the CTRL keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: altKey
properties.doc: true if one of the ALT keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: shiftKey
properties.doc: true if one of the SHIFT keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: metaKey
properties.doc: true if one of the META keys is pressed while the event is firing.

properties.name: detail
properties.doc: The number of times the mouse button has been used.

properties.name: screenX
properties.doc: The x-coordinate on the screen at which point the event occurred.

properties.name: screenY
properties.doc: The y-coordinate on the screen at which point the event occurred.

properties.name: clientX
properties.doc: The x-coordinate on the client at which point the event occurred.

properties.name: clientY
properties.doc: The y-coordinate on the client at which point the event occurred.

properties.name: button
properties.doc: The button being pressed while the event is executing. The value should be 0 for the primary mouse button (typically the left button), 1 for the tertiary mouse button (typically the middle button), and 2 for the secondary mouse button (typically the right button).

properties.name: relatedTarget
properties.doc: For mouseout events, this is the element that the mouse has moved to. For mouseover events, this is the element that the mouse has moved from. This argument is ignored for all other events.

params.name: view
params.doc: The view containing the target. This is typically the window object.

members.short_doc:
Injects a mouse event using the given event information to populate the event
object. ...

members.name: injectUIEvent
members.doc: Injects a UI event using the given event information to populate the event object.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: The type of event to fire. This can be any one of the following: click, dblclick, mousedown, mouseup, mouseout, mouseover and mousemove.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.doc: tru if the event can be bubbled up. DOM Level 2 specifies that all mouse events bubble by default.

properties.name: cancelable
properties.doc: true if the event can be canceled using preventDefault. DOM Level 2 specifies that all mouse events except mousemove can be canceled. This defaults to false for mousemove.

properties.name: detail
properties.doc: The number of times the mouse button has been used.

params.name: view
params.doc: The view containing the target. This is typically the window object.

members.short_doc:
Injects a UI event using the given event information to populate the event
object. ...

members.name: nextEvent
members.doc: This method is called after an event has been played to prepare for the next event.

params.name: eventDescriptor
params.doc: The descriptor of the event just played.

members.short_doc: This method is called after an event has been played to prepare for the next event. ...

members.name: onStart
onStop
peekEvent
members.doc: This method returns the event descriptor at the front of the queue. This does not dequeue the event. Repeated calls return the same object (until nextEvent is called).
members.short_doc: This method returns the event descriptor at the front of the queue. ...

members.name: processEvents
members.doc: This method dequeues and injects events until it has arrived at the time index. If no events are ready (based on the time index), this method does nothing.

return.name: return
return.doc: True if there is more to do; false if not (at least for now).

members.short_doc: This method dequeues and injects events until it has arrived at the time index. ...

members.name: processKeyFrame
members.doc: This method is called when a keyframe is reached. This will fire the keyframe event. If the keyframe has been handled, true is returned. Otherwise, false is returned.

return.name: return
return.doc: True if the keyframe was handled, false if not.

members.short_doc: This method is called when a keyframe is reached. ...

members.name: replaceEvent
members.doc:
Replaces an event in the queue with an array of events. This is often used to roll up a multi-step pseudo-event and expand it just-in-time to be played. The process for doing this in a derived class would be this:

 Ext.define('My.Player', {
     extend: 'Ext.ux.event.Player',

     peekEvent: function() {
         var event = this.callParent();

         if (event.multiStepSpecial) {
             this.replaceEvent(null, [
                 ... expand to actual events
             ]);

             event = this.callParent(); // get the new next event
         }

         return event;
     }
 });

This method ensures that the beforeplay hook (if any) from the replaced event is placed on the first new event and the afterplay hook (if any) is placed on the last new event.

params.name: index
params.doc: The queue index to replace. Pass null to replace the event at the current queueIndex.

params.name: events
params.doc: The array of events with which to replace the specified event.

members.short_doc: Replaces an event in the queue with an array of events. ...

members.name: start
members.doc: Starts this object. If this object is already started, nothing happens.
members.short_doc: Starts this object. ...

members.name: stop
members.doc: Stops this object. If this object is not started, nothing happens.
members.short_doc: Stops this object. ...

members.name: beforeplay
members.doc: Fires before an event is played.

params.name: eventDescriptor
params.doc: The event descriptor about to be played.

members.short_doc: Fires before an event is played. ...

members.name: keyframe
members.doc: Fires when this player reaches a keyframe. Typically, this is after events like click are injected and any resulting animations have been completed.
members.short_doc: Fires when this player reaches a keyframe. ...

members.name: start
members.doc: Fires when this object is started.
members.short_doc: Fires when this object is started. ...

members.name: stop
members.doc: Fires when this object is stopped.
members.short_doc: Fires when this object is stopped. ...

short_doc: This class manages the playback of an array of "event descriptors". ...
